4 #include <geometry_msgs/TransformStamped.h>
5 #include <string>

7 namespace ackermann_ekf {
8 
9 WheelencoderSensor::WheelencoderSensor(SensorArray &sensor_array,
10  const XmlRpc::XmlRpcValue &params,
11  ros::NodeHandle &nh)
12  : Sensor(sensor_array, params) {
13  // Disallow measurements which cannot be measured by this sensor from beeing
14  // fused
15  for (int i = 0; i < MEASUREMENT_SIZE; i++) {
16  // Only the dx_dt measurement is recorded in the WheelEncoder message
17  if (i != Measurement::dx_dt) {
18  measurement_.mask[i] = false;
19  }
20  }
21 
22  std::string topic = static_cast<std::string>(params["topic"]);
23 
24  ROS_INFO("Adding WheelEncoder sensor on topic %s", topic.c_str());
25 
26  subscriber_ = nh.subscribe(topic, 10, &WheelencoderSensor::callback, this);
27 }
28 
29 void WheelencoderSensor::callback(
30  const twizy_wheel_encoder::WheelEncoder::ConstPtr &msg) {
31  measurement_.time = msg->header.stamp.toSec();
32 
33  // If no transform exists we cannot determine e.g. sensor position so we
34  // are forced to discard the measurement
35  // Also attempt to bring filter time forward. If this cannot be achived, we
36  // must also return. Filter time is brought forward to emulate the Kalman
37  // predict step (which will then get skipped once the measurement is
38  // processed for real since the filter state is already for the correct
39  // time). Since the WheelEncoder message only supports positive speeds (both
40  // for forward and backward running) we must predict so we can judge the
41  // sign of current velocity according to the filter (see below).
42  geometry_msgs::TransformStamped transform;
43  if (!sensor_array_.get_transform(transform, msg->header) ||
44  !sensor_array_.bring_time_forward_to(measurement_.time)) {
45  return;
46  }
47 
48  this->set_sensor_position(transform);
49 
50  // Depending on the sign of forward speed according to filter state, make
51  // the measurement reflect that sign since WheelEncoder messages otherwise
52  // do not support negative velocities
53  double speed = sensor_array_.stable_filter->x(State::speed);
54  double dpitch_dx = sensor_array_.stable_filter->x(State::dpitch_dx);
55  double dyaw_dx = sensor_array_.stable_filter->x(State::dyaw_dx);
56  double y = measurement_.sensor_position(1);
57  double z = measurement_.sensor_position(2);
58  double h_speed = speed * (dpitch_dx * z - dyaw_dx * y + 1.0);
59  measurement_.z(Measurement::dx_dt) = h_speed > 0 ? msg->speed : -msg->speed;
60  // This covariance is faked since in reality it also depends e.g. on filter
61  // state speed covaraiance (and will in fact not be Gaussian at all...)
62  measurement_.R(Measurement::dx_dt, Measurement::dx_dt) = msg->covariance;
63 
64  // Since the measurement has been agumented by filter state from the
65  // stable_filter, fusing this measurement into the stable_filter could lead to
66  // instabilty - instead process as unstable measurement
67  sensor_array_.process_unstable_measurement(measurement_);
68 }
69 
70 } // namespace ackermann_ekf
